adverbs.description: downwind (comparative more downwind, superlative most downwind)

entries.meaning: in the same direction as the wind is blowing
examples: ... the aftermath of the dust-storm came up and caught us both, and drove us downwind like pieces of paper.

entries.meaning: (+ from) positioned relative to something in such a way that it can be smelled in the wind
examples: I don't want to live downwind from a pig farm.

entries.meaning: (aviation) in the direction opposite that of landing in a traffic pattern
